meanings.definition: The position or rank of a professor.
meanings.sent1: Her professorship at the university was highly respected.
meanings.sent2: He was awarded the professorship after years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The professorship of mathematics required a lot of dedication.
meanings.sent4: In the academic world, achieving a professorship is a significant milestone.
meanings.sent5: The professorship brought with it a sense of accomplishment and pride.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities of a professor.
meanings.sent1: His professorship involved teaching, research, and mentoring students.
meanings.sent2: The professorship required him to publish papers regularly.
meanings.sent3: Balancing all the professorship tasks was challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent4: She juggled her professorship duties with grace and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The professorship entailed long hours but also intellectual fulfillment.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a professor.
meanings.sent1: His professorship lasted for ten years before he retired.
meanings.sent2: The professorship of the department head was coming to an end.
meanings.sent3: The professorship of the dean was extended for another year.
meanings.sent4: The professorship of the chairperson was marked by innovation and growth.
meanings.sent5: The professorship of the senior faculty member inspired many young academics.
